intro: Lepisanthes senegalensis, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Lepisanthes senegalensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
